Client/Server Protocol
This client/server protocol is the aspect of LiveJournal that makes it a little more unique than other journal systems.
Currently there are two types of interfaces available to the LiveJournal protocol, the older "flat" interface, or the XML-RPC interface. The XMLRPC interface is probably easiest to use, because there are quite a few XML-RPC resources available to developers in just about any programming language. If you're in a situation that requires you to write your own interface wrapper, then the flat interface is probably best to use.
Internally, both interfaces are just wrappers around the same APIs. Don't worry too much about which one you use, as they accomplish the same thing.
The flat interface is not yet a part of this documentation. If you wish to utilize it in place of XML-RPC, please visit
&ljp.csp.xml-rpc.index;
